Constructs a new instance of the InsertionSort class and sets the sort order to ascending if true, descending if false.

Method Detail

insertionSort

public void insertionSort(Sortable collection,
                          int beginIndex,
                          int endIndex)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
This method implements the "insertion sort" algorithm to sort a collection of objects. This class is used by the QuickSort class to sort the remaining data less than the sortThreshold.
Parameters:
beginIndex - is the begin row index in the collection where the insertion sort starts sorting elements.
endIndex - is the end row index in the collection where the insertion sort stops sorting elements.
Throws:
Ljava.lang.Exception -

sortAscending

public void sortAscending(boolean sortAscending)
sortAscending sets the sort order on the collection of objects when the sort routine is called.
Parameters:
sortAscending - is a boolean value indicating true to sort ascending or false to sort descending.
